V7SFQRr54paWRjuB1b8QbQ.text: Amazing food and service! The staff was so friendly and helpful.  The food was fresh and hot.  I got pad thai , crab puffs,  & Thai tea.  They were so delicious!  I'm definitely coming back and recommending this place to everyone!

kzwSWnDa3aivVsnxo7xr9Q.text: Just had dinner here and my family really liked the food.  We had the chicken wings, chicken green curry and beef fried rice and the yummy coconut ice cream with pineapple.  We found the employees and the owner very nice and friendly.  The service was excellent.  It isn't a fancy restaurant but it is cozy.     I would come back again if I lived in town but we live out of country.  Thanks Chanpen, we really liked the food particularly the green curry dish.

12kRuG3JeIMNzuN9NoY0Xw.text: Excellent food ... ordered dinner for carry out.  Had the Spicy Sweet Basil (combination) entree and chicken wings.  Ordered a 3 on their hotness scale which was perfect for me!!  I would definitely return.

o1t-QN0rIr91BJyMSvpkxw.text: The food is great. The staff were nice. You get cucumber water to drink as your water.  Wonton soup was big enough to feed two and the chow mein was flavorful. I recommend this place

KVgVEy_V972BKEZ5loBgvg.text: GREAT prices - just $7.95 lunch specials, many to choose from. They let me customize the spice level of the dish I ordered which was much appreciated.  They forgot to get me the beverage I ordered until I finally approached the counter and asked for it near the end of my meal, but I will still say that the service was very friendly. I'm guessing this was a rare mistake.

photos.caption: Photo of Chanpen Thai Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken Panang. they let me pick a level of hot from 0-5. I picked 1. If I did it over, I&#39;d pick 2. It was a little sweet.
Photo of Chanpen Thai Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. I love that there was automatically a lime in my water
Photo of Chanpen Thai Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Thai iced tea. I liked it. Just a little spice and a little sweet. Not overpowering

Ly15JiG1YJM_fDyA21xKCg.text: The pineapple red curry and drunken noodles are excellent. The hotness scale really varies depending on the chef. I've had 5's that were mild and 4's that have blown my mind but I still love this place.

OBWBgOOzsaILed3r_nM8QA.text: Summary: sub par Thai food,I've had much better but there seems to be slim pickings in the area so if you have a craving go here and get the Tom yum. If you're into pad Thai that is quite wet then it'll be right up your alley.  Came here on Christmas Eve for dinner and it was pretty full and they had a decent amount of people getting take out. Parking was easy since it's in a strip mall like area. The waitress was hard to communicate with she didn't listen well especially for the fact that English was her second language. Note: English isn't my parents first language so we're quite used to this, but it was difficult for us. Tried the following dishes and nothing was memorable: fried rice, sate, pad see ew, pad thai your typical Thai staples. I've had so much better in Cincinnati, Columbus, and Milwaukee and these are large cities.  The only thing that was good was the Tom yum soup. Good variety of elements as well as a solid heat and sourness that I love.

0XMUDSfBPEaL02vhQOeMeg.text: Food and service is great but the air conditioning in this restaurant, not so much! You only get the fan if you sit in a certain area so it makes it a little hard to enjoy the amazing food! Didn't wait long on food but appetizer came after our main meals...

0Ui8sG_3zvV7YfYIROgLVw.text: My coworkers and I have been loyal customers for the longest time. We went in for lunch and we noticed it was a bit busier but of course it was lunch time. So we went in and they told us to sit wherever. The waitress brought water and our soups. We noticed she was taking longer than usual and seem to be attending other guest more than us. So we tried to get her attention and that didnt work. So we tried to get the waiters attention, we thought he didn't hear us. Tried to get his attention again and clearly ignored us. The waiter was attending the table next to us, those customers told him that we were trying to get his attention. The waiter tells those two customers, " oh they always come here but leave no tip." Our jaws dropped! We've been loyal customers and were regulars. For that waiter to tell that to other customers was not only disrespectful but unprofessional. I will never go back in this restaurant. I have never been so embarrassed. We asked for the waiters name and to speak to the manager and were told that the manager would be in later. We walked back "later" and no manager. To the owner of this restaurant, if that's the type of wait staff you have working for you then expect to lose business for waiters/waitresses that feel they are obligated to receive tips for below average service.

NEOyp3LEZg3-Ta0VM2Ag1A.text: We were not excited about our experience at this Thai spot.  There was no air conditioning on a 110 degree day.  Fans were blowing hot air around!  The food was sub-par.  The fresh rolls were not chilled, had to request peanut sauce with them and the Tom yum lemongrass soup was not the best.  The pot stickers were fried as opposed to steamed and uninteresting.  We tried this location based upon other reviews and certainly had a different experience.  Sorry but this is an honest review.

Nxl3Xp9NABw4AoJ5E_84ug.text: I hate that this transpired because this is super close to work and the people who work there are super nice. The last time I ordered take out will be truly the last time as I found a ROACH in my curry and only after I'd eaten some. I reported it to the Health Department who never followed up with me. The gal from Chan Pen when I called to let them know what happened offered a free dish "next time" but didn't sound a bit surprised to hear of the issue...

YaFfDqbO1FtrbyVqMxBnhg.text: I was so pleased to learn that Chanpen opened a new location 4 weeks ago and it is larger to accommodate more people with the same great quality of food.   The location is in the Fry's Food plaza, on the northeast corner of 48th Street and Baseline in Tempe. The atmosphere is open and clean, with more tables to accommodate parties small and large.   I ordered the Pad Thai lunch special for $7.95 and it came with soup, a veggie eggroll and a wonton crisp. It was, as expected, extremely good.   The staff is very nice and I had a chance to chat with one of the co-owners. All in all I hope that this place succeeds because it has the best Thai food in the Phoenix area.

photos.caption: Photo of Chanpen Thai Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken panang lunch special - flavorful and came recommended - $7.95 at time of posting (8/2015)
Photo of Chanpen Thai Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Coconut ice cream! It&#39;s made in house, and it&#39;s not too heavy. Perfect after a spicy meal.

dT9JELv3-QgS4N9xamjmmg.text: Oh dearrrr!!  This place is amazing. From the food to the service!   We had coconut soup as an appetizer. It fed 3 starved persons. We then had green duck curry and yellow duck curry. The whole meal was delicious. Everything was tasty. We were surprise when we received the bill because we expected it to be way higher.  It turned out to be 45$ for 3 persons.   The waiters were adorable. We will definitely come back!!!

IWrxgm0e8PKSwTUKCSQg3Q.text: This is the best Thai restaurant I've ever tasted. The green curry is my favorite dish although it burns hotter than Drogon from game of thrones. Over all it's a good place you should try! Like now.

kf4X5HLBHI-ocfpQXiEUPA.text: The Mango special with shrimp was very tasty. Large portions and fresh. Service was very good and food came out very quickly.

G5-wO7cRpVi8SsacUFUhNw.text: I Love Love this place ! Nice and speedy fast service. My water was full at all times. I ordered the Red curry. Came out fresh and hot!! Spice levels , Love. Oh my gosh!! My mouth was screaming. it was so happy with all the tasty flavors, just making your mouth water typing this.   My guy ordered shrimp and almond stir fry. Mmm.. level 5. But it was AMAZING!   They brought us a Fried banana with side of vanilla ice cream.. mmm.. nuts and some honey or thin syrup.   I will order forever now.    Small parking space but worth going.   So close and not in Tempe    Will be back.

c368x8RmrJBg7O9Ls_uaAw.text: First-timer and will definitely return to try other items!!  Everything we had was delish!!--chicken satay, crab puffs, yellow curry, spicy fried rice, pad Thai, Thai iced tea, and Thai iced coffee.    Our main waitress was great; her helper didn't understand very much English, she didn't know what salt was.  Busy place with diners and take-out orders.

SWriVOjdGnBkRdtcVJCKZw.text: They're food is SOOOOOOOO DELICIOUSLY AUTHENTIC!!! We're super stuffed from their extra generously, serving hand. We had an appetizer, two dishes and desert for $36. First, the fresh spring rolls were giant and served with a lovely aromatic peanut sauce. Second, yellow curry (spice level 3) was barely spicy and super creamy with the perfect consistency. Lastly, the heavenly pineapple coconut ice cream with fried bananas..... to die for!!   What are you waiting for? Hurry up and go try this place, totally worth it!!

vQ1d8QxqnaCK-8a9zqOwVw.text: Hands down best Thai restaurant ever. From service to taste.  The first time I ate at Chanpen Thai it was about 6 years ago, my old bosses brought me lunch and I was in love with every dish. From that day on I ate Chanpen Thai every other day.   After moving from Arizona to Miami I have tried 20 or more different places and nothing compares to Chanpen Thai.  They have the best curry and the best fried rise also the best best Pad Thai. You can also order it different type of spicy level from 1 being the lowest in spice and 5 being the hottest lol don't get it! We always get 3-4 or get a 3 and ask for extra spice on the side.   So if you decide to dine in your experience will be much better. You get greeted right away and you can sit anywhere you choose also no reservations need it.   The service is so fast they bring big mason jars of water with limo right away and then get your order. At the end of your meal they bring you a free desert. Usually the ice cream of the day and it's made the same day. You will love it, portions are big enough to share but usually you will want your own plate or order few plates so you can try a little of everything and take home the rest.   My mouth is watering right now and wishing I was in Arizona.

GF-NvJauYD0tW58jMNm-8A.text: Great food and service. I had the spicy basil fried rice 4 hot and my buddy had the pad see ouk also level 4 spice. Everything was very tasty. We also had 2 large thai ice teas.  Owner came out to greet us and brought us complimentary coconut ice cream to relieve the heat lol Going level 5 next time.  Well be back. Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Chanpen Thai Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Spicy bastill fried rice and pad see ouk

H9xgJGDjTaoRX8F1s4qKeA.text: Had a fabulous dinner at this restaurant last night! Came out quickly and as expected! We ordered an appetizer of the crab cheese puffs that were cooked well, not too crispy but the wrapper wasn't too thick either. Perfect combination of crab chunks and cheese too which was great to see!   I ordered the chicken pad Thai for my entree which came out piping hot and delicious! I can't do too much spice so opted for a 1 spice level which ended up being perfect for my 5-year old palette. It was slightly sweeter than I'm used too but the noodles were well cooked, the sauce wasn't too heavy, and the chicken wasn't overdone or dry.   My husband honestly can't remember what his dish was called but it was a yellow curry with noodles and crispy noodles on top. The waitress recommended it and it was so good he literally wanted to lick the bowl when it was done!   Happy with our first visit! Will definitely be back!

kfBU7YKCmqGYXlMR_Pnxjg.text: I've only had takeout from here, but it's the best Thai I've found in this immediate area. Prices are reasonable and the people at the carry out area are always nice.  The ambiance leaves much to be desired ( part of the reason we takeout), but I'd still recommend it.  If you like spice, definitely don't order anything under a level 3. Enjoy!

WykkpwVjgEl9ADkQC1sXZg.text: On our first visit, we knew that we had just eaten some of the best Thai food in the valley.  On the second visit, they didn't have chow mein available, which was a letdown, but we ordered two Pad Thai plates instead and were not disappointed; one with with chicken and shrimp and another with a combo of 4 protein; chicken, shrimp, pork, ans beef.  My hubby was thrilled with the amount of protein on the pad Thai.  He was in meat heaven.  As an appetizer, we tried the chicken satay which comes with a creamy peanut sauce and is a good portion for the money.   We wanted to try a few Thai beers, so we ordered the Singha lager which was more on the malty side, and Chang, which Hubby loved because it was so refreshing.  They even used proper glassware, which made this beer nerd swoon!   At the end of the meal they bring you a free scoop of ice cream.  I am a huge fan of the coconut flavor that has little chunks of fresh coconut.  The green tea is pretty tasty too.

_jUE0YgYKnLCY_592dvu9g.text: Favorite Thai place I've been to in Arizona. Eat in or order to go either is amazing. I usually kick it with the spicy fried rice but their tom kha is wonderful, the curries are great, and their drunken noodles rule. I've also had their pad Thai and as someone who by rule hates peanuts I LOVED the way they made this. Staff is amazing, even when slammed they make sure to get your food out quickly and correct!

zAtrbbAZ-mvYm8LiX69pyg.text: This began as a 4 star review. But before I posted it, the waitress asked if we'd like a little complimentary scoop of coconut ice cream...well YEEEES! It was excellent and easily tipped the scale to 5 stars because now I don't need to go to the donut shop next door for ice cream!  The Pad Thai is very good ($11) and comes with both chicken and Shrimp. There wasn't a whole lot of chicken even though I asked for extra chicken and NO shrimp!  But since I don't need a lot of meat I was fine. (There is also a vegetarian option ($10).  I thought it was a bit dry and not as sweet as I prefer so I asked for a side of Hoisin sauce which made it perfect.   The red curry with Tofu ($12) was also very flavorful. We forgot to ask for brown rice and the waitress didn't ask our preference. It came with white rice...so we asked for brown. It was still cooking but came about 10 minutes later. The menu states to pick the spice level 0-5. I ordered my Pad Thai "zero" (and it had zero heat)! But I accidentally ordered the red curry MILD which should have been ordered zero because "mild" was really too spicy for me. My husband was fine with it.   It's interesting that both dishes looked as bland on the plate as they do in the pictures. There isn't any effort to add slivered carrots to the Pad Thai to give it some color, etc. But the bland look is not a problem once you take a bite.   If we are through here again we will return, and hopefully on a week day 11-3! when the lunch specials look great and more reasonably priced!  If you find this review useful, please vote!

9WSW1JAFuA3fh8VONGpCxw.text: Pretty darn good Thai food. Got back from Thailand for vacation about a year ago and was really excited to see that one of their daily specials was Khao Soi. Thought this was very comparable to what we got in Chiang Mai and was pleased with the diversity of the menu. We got complimentary coconut ice cream before we left and felt well cared for. Our wait was a bit long, but was worth the quality and quantity of food that we got. Fair prices and good service. Will stop by again.

oqnyTH45aAGorCAY9XC_fA.text: Great small local Thai spot.  Came in and grabbed a seat and water was brought out almost immediately.  She told my order and brought my appetizer out pretty quickly.  I was behind a large party so my food took a little bit (maybe 15 mins) and it was delicious.  All the waitresses help everyone.  The Pad Thai was amazing.  Large portions so I had to take more than half of it home.  To my surprise they give you free green tea ice cream after while you pay the bill. Dinner and appetizer was $15 so fairly cheap for such an amazing dinner.

CSZylsxnUQobVvgFcSas2A.text: Great meal here. I had the vegetarian soup. They were accommodating and allowed me to add fried tofu. Good flavors. I requested spicy and it actually was pretty spicy.

jOxhrBbaUvVXCnXutjmYlQ.text: Found this on Yelp as I am visiting my corporate office in Phoenix. I was greeted immediately and given water. It seems like they have a team-based approach to waiting on tables so they continually come by and check on you. I ordered red curry with seafood and it was made freshly piping hot, and wonderful. The rice was fresh and the prices were reasonable. Great job and there's a reason why there's so many great ratings

photos.caption: Photo of Chanpen Thai Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States

McbnXvlDt0GfQc_iSzLw4g.text: Why oh why can't this restaurant be a chain and also be located in Tucson, Az?????     This was hands down the best Thai food I've had in a really, really long time!  We found this gem on YELP!!  We got there at 11:55a and it was already packed!  A great sign, right?  They have a great selection on their menu, but we opted for the smaller lunch special menu ($7.95).  It includes a fried wonton and spring roll!  Yum!    We got the yellow curry with chicken (mild) and pad thai with chicken (mild).  Both were perfection on the plate.  There was a bit of spice but just Royo make the dishes flavorful.  The service was great.  They bring huge glass jugs of water with cucumber in them.  So, you don't to keep asking for refills!    I can't wait to go back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Chanpen Thai Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken and Shrimp Pad Thai!!

M-2kv0lb8w6-qKAvBLsONg.text: Even if we didn't live right around the corner from this place, I'd still make the drive to come here. Their food is always filling and delicious. I love the option for the level of spice 1-5 and they always make it a point to warn you if the peppers they got in range on the more spicy side. Usually I get the chicken choice with the entree I chose, either the Rah-na, Drunken Noodle or Teriyaki, or my new FAVORITE the Cashew Stir-fry, but tonight, I tried the veggie option and it was so amazing. Filled to the top with all my favorite things. I didn't think it would fill me up as well as the chicken but it did, I'd unbutton my pants if it wasn't considered inappropriate. We also opted to try to Wonton soup tonight which is served with a mini fire underneath to keep the soup warm, which is the coolest thing I have ever seen, especially with my "cold soup" phobia. The complimentary ice cream to clean and calm our palate afterwards is always our favorite part of meal. Oh and not to mention, their thai tea is always the best.

D9_xDWdQghpcK2kfTzo7XQ.text: I was excited to try this place with a group of friends on a Monday evening. I've heard good things about their Broadway location in Phoenix and when a friend suggested this larger location, we were on board. It wasn't too busy around 530/6 and I immediately loved the vibe and aesthetics of the restaurant, felt inviting and well decorated.   We stuck with water for our drinks and ordered different entrees: avocado curry, green curry, pad see eww and I got the spring rolls appetizer and vegetables pad thai with tofu. Everyone enjoyed their dishes; I liked my rolls but would've preferred a peanut sauce to accompany them rather than their sweet sauce, also could've used more shrimp. My dish was fantastic, I chose a 4/5 spice level and it was packing serious heat. I was happy not eating much because I ended up with leftovers for two days. Even the leftovers were tasty, and they weren't as spicy since the microwave can only heat up food so much versus a skillet or pot.  After our plates were cleared and boxed up, one of the staff members brought us complimentary green tea ice cream, which was a lovely ending to our meal. Our waitress was efficient and kind as she made sure we were attended to and split our checks. FYI: they add an 18% gratuity to parties of 6 or more, but you can add to it if you'd like. Overall, I have nothing bad to say about Chanpen and look forward to trying other dishes and visiting their original location.

photos.caption: Photo of Chanpen Thai Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Green tea ice cream
Photo of Chanpen Thai Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Vegetable pad thai with tofu
Photo of Chanpen Thai Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Spring rolls

EV-8mROre9xqu5oqVluiaQ.text: AMAZING!!!! Totally loved the food!!! Went there today for lunch (Tempe Location) and the food blew my taste buds away! Ordered the red and panang curries, both were just soooo good! What I loved most was that both the curries were thick, just the way I like it! Very flavorful! And for $7.95?? I'd have gladly paid more. I have one suggestion though, if you like your curries spicy, go with the medium spicy option. If you tell them to go a little over medium spicy, trust me they'd take your request very seriously :D such a great find!!! And the servers arr sweet!

rFWPi6ojo_u4TF1L6_qKgQ.text: I love Thai food.. spice.. lime.. cilantro.. basil .. chili for heat .. noodles and all the combinations of those items! This place is located in the Frys shopping center on the side off Baseline and has delicious Lunch specials   They open at 11am and at 11:05 there were 7 people seated when I walked in today.. perfect lunch spot. You are greeted with a jar of cold water and a cup of soup.. yum!  On today's visit I had the spicy Thai basil with pork .. medium spice.. lots of veggies and great flavors.. perfect bite size veggies still had a bite (no mushy overcooked veggies here) .. served with white rice, a small veggie egg roll and 2 crispy wonton chips..   The staff here is friendly .. food is comes out of the kitchen quickly .. lots of flavor.. you will not be disappointed !!

photos.caption: Photo of Chanpen Thai Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken Panang curry w/rice &amp; egg roll

YtgCG0tFrYOgwWa6gsnRxA.text: Absolutely the best place I've ever eaten in Tempe, and this may now end up being the *only* place I will eat in Tempe.   Walk in with a group of three and we're immediately acknowledged and are seated. Water in these adorable mason jars is brought and we are looking over the menu. Friendly service from start to finish.   The table tried out their appetizer sampler platter. After waiting a few minutes for it to come out, a server comes out and apologizes, stating that they are out of the "fresh rolls" that are supposed to be part of the appetizer plate. This really is not a big deal to me, and I assume they'll just add an extra egg roll or something. But instead she has brought out 6 chicken skewers for us instead and is apologizing again. It was such a great way for them to apologize. And the chicken skewers are amazing, by the way--they come with a really amazing peanut sauce!   The rest of the platter follows. Egg rolls are on point, very crispy (just like I like them to be!). Crab puffs were great and have nice chunks of crab inside of them. Really good grab to creme cheese mixture and they were cooked perfectly. There were also potstickers, which were also glamorous and those were eaten rather quickly. The big bacon wrapped shrimp were good, and this is a big thing for me to say because normally I'm not a shrimp fan--but they were great.   Moral: The appetizers here are amazing and I highly recommend everything!   As for the entrees, one guest at the table got a standard chicken mein dish and it was amazing. Lots of veggies in the portion which was nice. And the portion was very big as well.   Me and another guest got the yellow curry------yes! Great taste, great portion, the potatoes were nicely cooked, loved the carrots, and the chicken was very tender. The best curry I've had in awhile and I absolutely loved it. LOVED it.   As we were paying the server brought out complimentary green tea ice cream, again, great service. Very delicious.   I'll definitely be back here when I return to Tempe or just drive through. This was a great little location that had good ambience, stellar service, and even better food. Thanks for having us!

DFXt7oK4ksF759EJktfw3Q.text: Great tasting food, and free coconut pineapple ice cream to finish your meal. We had the Phad Thai, fried rice and yellow curry (favorite)!

QX5KfPPfJOwfz8ICK7t4kQ.text: In from Denver and had an exceptional meal with my family. Red curry was superb as was the Thai basil. Our son had Pad Thai which I sampled and it was super as well. Highly recommend this place.

upP7mA8hsZxkOmQfiN52EQ.text: Great food, fast service and just the right amount of spice (for this lightweight).  I had planned to pick up something at the neighborhood grocery store but glad I decided to treat myself.

V0NmkStctXQb3BJyjIPQpg.text: This place was AMAZING!!!! Food and service Solid Gold!! 10!! Mod had amazing recommendations. We had dumplings and fresh shrimp rolls to start. Both chicken and shrimp in Pad Thai- mild and sweet! Loved the fresh bean sprouts and crumbled peanuts piled high on side. But if you like spice... The drunken noodles and the Royal curry were both out of this world! Beer and wine. Final surprise...green tea ice cream.  Don't Miss this place!!   In town at Arizona Grand for few days with no car. 10 min walk and worth it!!!

iJ6yuOrQKD1XiPY0o58BfQ.text: This was definitely one of the better dining experience I've had since moving to Arizona from California. There weren't that many tables filled, but the customer service was very attentive and conversational, so the vibe of this place was causal and welcoming. The food was also amazing. I typically get Pad See Yew at Thai restaurants and it was one of the best I've had, and the best I've had in Arizona. Then my boyfriend got the Panang curry and it was so nutty and flavorful, I almost regretted getting Pad See Yew. And to top off this great dining experience, they gave us green tea ice cream. And it didn't taste store bought either. The only thing I would criticize is that they didn't really give us or offer usual condiments I've had at Thai restaurants, like fish sauce with Thai chiles, or little jalapenos with soy sauce, and etc.

photos.caption: Photo of Chanpen Thai Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Panang Curry and Pad See Yew, yum!

AU45nftFK3tsWs8oZjDUaA.text: Had the chicken satay appetizer and Panang curry and sweet and sour with chicken. Both entrees were very very good and the service was very friendly and efficient. Prices are very reasonable considering the amount of food served. Our bill came to $ 32.61 before gratuity. In addition, they offered us complimentary green tea ice cream which was a nice ending to our meal. Thank you Chanpen Thai for a wonderful evening!

VWV_uONibmS3rSlDxFQzEQ.text: I eat an absurd amount of Thai food and have to say this is one of the best I've had in a while. I ordered the coconut soup (Tom kha kai) vegetarian style, drunken noodles with tofu, vegetarian pad thai and banana sticky rice. Everything blew my expectations away. The service was quick and friendly, prices are reasonable and portions are generous. Mod helped me out and he was helpful, not only with recommendations on food here, but other places to check out while I'm staying in Phoenix area. Highly recommend this place, especially the coconut soup!!

pR8WKHAMDsv4i1Blm7G_6Q.text: The food was great. The customer service was good as well. I will deft eat here again!

Klrq5XJD-1dBIfgKruK2BQ.text: My friend recommended this place and it was one of the best thai food's ever. It was not like fast food types. They took care of each food they served. They served the best thai ice tea and their green curry with vegetables was just so creamy and amazing! Definitely recommend this place!

K5rPVvujWJntgewfwoMjaw.text: Great place to order take out and have hubby pick up on his way home!  He gets either sweet & sour or a rice dish, but I've tried several dishes, curries, seafood, wontons, and everything we've ordered has been fresh, hot and flavorful!

8YJeXsTS09ZDC1AI-I2scA.text: My boyfriends absolute favorite restaurant! I'm not going to lie my favorite is the complimentary green tea ice cream haha. Worth the try

K7-gdQJ1Oz5cyji6Pv5d1w.text: Why is it that all of the best restaurants in Phoenix are in strip malls?  After hiking south mountain, this little restaurant off baseline caught my eye so I stopped in for some soup (Tom yum/lemongrass).  Here's what impressed me:  1. Extremely flavorful broth, appropriately spicy (I ordered level 3 hot) 2. They did NOT skimp on the chicken  3. Hot pot with a live flame kept my soup hot 4. Egg rolls came out right away and were tasty too 5. Ice water came out in a jar, with slice of cucumber 6. Complimentary scoop of ice cream! 7. Good bang for your buck  Looking forward to coming back and trying some entrees.

S8jFX0Hykx_p-kD3etqYaQ.text: Great Thai food - very True Thai flavor and cooking styles. Tops in my books and I eat at a lot of Thai places!!!

fWTIhJnLfOIcmYa93b1c8w.text: Ok, calling it. After our year residency, Chanpen has been the-hands down- best thai food spot we've had in AZ and will be one of the go to eateries in general. Great service, topped with delicious food and was decently priced... man, you got us. Apparently we'd been waiting some time for our food as they apologized and offered us veggie spring rolls which despite the lack of meat was just yumms-and that's coming from an avid meat eater. We didn't really notice the wait as we were jamming out to the eccelctic music selection ranging from Kpop, to Thai pop, to early 2000 slow jams. We'd eaten here before but this was the first time we devoured everything in one sitting. We ordered the chicken larb, pad Thai, and spicy basil fried rice.  everything was deloycious, perfectly portioned, and just hit all the right spots. They topped us off with a green tea ice cream (last time they had coconut) which was just the perfect end. Will come back, will recommend to anyone who's hungry. Chanpen...you got us. We got gotten.  Wanted to note, it's rare to find a thai place that isn't afraid to give you the spice level you ask for, almost anywhere. Not watered down, but real spice. Accidentally asked for a 10 once and they did not play (didn't realize their scale was 0-5). It was still so good but definitely a mistake. Stuck to their scale this time and everything was perfection.

FcWKGtQeiEcCoi9lb6qZSQ.text: Place was great! Nice service and delicious food. They provided us with complimentary coconut ice cream also which was a great bonus!

ta3qvkj0DQlJy8eiVnvtDQ.text: I'm not even joking, this was the first time I'd had pad Thai before, and I literally went home and bought a plane ticket to Thailand. I went a couple weeks afterwards, and the food tasted identical to top notch restaurants in thailand. This place is AMAZING. I've tried lots of Thai restaurants since, and the only place in the US that has come close to comparing to Thailand is Chanpen. They even have Chang beer, which is so authentic! Also, try the mango sticky rice. Absolutely fantastic. Then again, everything on the menu is!!! Definitely go here if you're looking for motivation to travel across the world. It's THAT good.

L9G-UI2RPrmN0FKRl2_CVA.text: Chanpen Thai serves up a decent meal in this part of Tempe and has enough vegetarian options to keep things interesting for more than one meal.   The carrots were crinkle cut, but the broccoli tasted like it was never frozen. The tofu was gently fried before going into any dish, which was a nice touch. Chanpen added chili oil when I asked for a dish to be spicier - there wasn't a thai chili pepper taste. They didn't ask how hot I wanted my dishes to be, an oddity for a Thai restaurant, but something I'm encountering more frequently. The Thai hot here was probably a medium hot elsewhere. The curry and noodle dishes were a bit too sweet.   Do you ever wonder what the history of baby corn is, and how it made its way into your stir-fried noodles and my drunken noodles? Which consumer segment continues to demand baby corn such that it commands a huge per pound premium over full grown corn? I really don't like the taste, so I'm a bit puzzled. This is something worth digging up on NPR or Wikipedia, but I feel a twinge of laziness coming on.   It was never quite clear if lunch was counter service or sit down. The food came out quickly here though. Chanpen was never busy either - I went for lunch and dinner, sometimes alone and with colleagues, and never ran into a wait or crowded restaurant.   If you don't feel like driving further into Tempe or Phoenix, this is probably the only Thai restaurant in a decent radius. Thai Elephant Bistro is nearby, but isn't necessarily a step change above Chanpen.

photos.caption: Photo of Chanpen Thai Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Drunken noodles (left) and red curry with tofu (right)

VumDDaqs2hnO2OoEATZgsQ.text: This is the best Thai lunch special meal you will get in the greater Tempe area. There are many like it, but this one is the best. They serve the best Asian spaghetti I've ever had.

LwjmiUuPtafUjFXikvunaQ.text: I LOVE this place, I have become a regular since moving nearby. Service is always prompt, polite, efficient. The food is always fresh, quick, and DELICIOUS. I almost always order the yellow royal curry with chicken, with 4/5 heat level. The spring rolls are also very good. I have tried the red curry and enjoyed it as well, but my favorite is the yellow royal curry. The staff is also what makes this place great, they treat the customers well and even offer complimentary ice cream!

photos.caption: Photo of Chanpen Thai Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Spring rolls, royal yellow curry with chicken, and extra rice.  LOVE IT!

Z0CqRitNEFPTui_Ce5dF9Q.text: We tried to order takeout from here and the person on the phone got frustrated that I couldn't understand him the first time and once we finally got everything cleared up, he hung up the phone before confirming that we were done. So we called back and canceled the order. So I can't say anything about the quality of food, just the poor quality of service.

cLFNL27x6RSWYraxBTS2QQ.text: Some of the best tom ka gai I've ever had. Huge portions and really good quality. They gave us a cup of coconut ice cream with pineapple at the end of our meal, which appears to be homemade. All in all very good stuff!

qyFQZz_MrI04hmy-7JHMlQ.text: Amazing food with a lot of spice and flavor! Their yellow curry is amazing and so is their red curry! One of my absolute favorite places to grab lunch, and their lunch prices are way affordable... Much less than a gross and greasy fast food combo meal!

pF2Pj1kPyiiLljLpN0fVaA.text: Delicious and authentic thai food! My wife and I both got curry and LOVED it. We highly recommend this place!

sA3bVFV2QtOvOokH5da36g.text: Fantastic customer service. The staff is friendly and willing to assist in anyway. I came in for a takeout order. The restaurant itself is modern and chic despite its location in a strip mall. The food is delicious and comes in ample portions. I am a local who came in for the first time. I will be coming back as often as I can. I am sure the food will spur my cravings more often. Definitely a must try for locals or those just passing through.

QzhZ4Gux7Ja8QcfUjBX7pA.text: Our coconut soup and massaman curry were absolutely delicious! The coconut pineapple ice cream was unexpected and a very nice touch to finish the meal. The staff were all very gracious and prompt.

tSa-3vfarLcyOxmUqXpbKg.text: In town for business and noticed this place had good reviews, so thought I would give it a try. Great pad Thai! One of the best I've had.

UtzwDwb_sIKdCnw8APJEBw.text: Great food and finally a good dine in option in this area. Nice service and some of the best Thai j have had in a long time. The satay was good. The drunken noodles was fantastic

5a_VPEF7tRqyMuooBx36Dg.text: Great food prepared as you order, very friendly atmosphere and extremely accommodating to changes requested. Clearly our Thai restaurant of choice in Phoenix.

DwEm8Wo-zacUNxun_PDZgQ.text: DON'T DO IT! Food is good, but service is horrible.  ESPECIALLY DON'T DO PICK UP.  After waiting 20 minutes longer than we were told and they wouldn't give us a refund, we got our food after AN HOUR.  We WERE regulars but will make the extra trek to Wild Thaiger.

h2tRJiYwwkS-ODBVn5SFxQ.text: The food here is very good, tasty and spicy. So please be extra careful if you are sensitive to spice levels.  You can feel the taste of ingredients in the food. ZT-nhEVj5TmrMat4kHEHhA.text: It's consistently fantastic. I've had a lot of Thai food and this is the best I've ever had!

BO7hTlUOw6bfXROlZlko7A.text: Great food! I used carry out and they gave me a cold bottle of water! Great idea in the Arizona heat.

KyiWRt4acADE1mzMc6jneg.text: My wife and I came into this place for lunch and I was really impressed. The food was really good, the Thai iced coffee was off the hook and the staff was really attentive. Even their music selection was on point. Being from NYC and eating at so many Thai restaurants, I think this place can really hold its own.

cso5oeKqz67CTpJ6ZzsJqQ.text: If you don't get anything else from this review, please get that they mean spicy when they say spicy and even a 2 out of 5 is not for the faint of heart.  My drunken noodles for lunch were a little spicier than I usually get, but really good.  My mom's pad thai was also pretty warm, and was served with lemon instead of lime.  WTF? Who does that? Are there no limes in Phoenix? I have to have a crap ton of fresh lime juice to enjoy pad thai, but my mom isn't as into it as I am.  I would have sent it back, but I didn't order it so its a moot point.  Let's just say that my husband's yellow curry that he ordered as a 4/5 was too hot for me to even try.  It was just about too hot for him to eat.  And believe me, he likes stuff hot.  He said it was just about the hottest Thai he'd ever had.  I think we'll be back, since forewarned is forearmed!  I'll be sticking with a 1 or 2, he'll probably knock his down to a 2 or 3.  Now, I wasn't a fan of the cucumber water but it was drinkable.  My food was hot enough that I would have drunk it even if it wasn't.  Service was terrible, though.  I don't feel its unreasonable to expect you to keep my glass full, or to get my husband some water without cucumber in it.  They weren't able to manage to meet my expectations on that front.  Their prices were reasonable and the value for money was all right.  So it's a mixed bag.  Try it for lunch and stick with low numbers, you'll be fine.

um0Norpdi83pvez29zS0AQ.text: Excellent Thai food -- some of the best we have had around here!! The wait staff was so kind and the restaurant was nice and clean.  The complimentary ice cream was a great wait to end the meal. We will definitely be back!!

h3FC0Vx94McMRCHOx8KRGg.text: Good Thai food for a good price. I have been there two times in the span of two days because the food is good, the prices are reasonable, and the service is good. We tried the standards: Pad Thai, Pad See Ew, and Royal Curry. All were delicious. As with all Thai food, be careful on the spice level you choose. You get to choose from 0-5. I first tried 1. It was good, but personally, I like a lot more spice so I added chili sauce to it. The next time, I ordered 3. Perfect. Spicy enough to have you mouth breathing and drinking water between bites, but not so spicy that you can't enjoy the flavor.  When in doubt, choose a low number and add spice as needed. The lunch special is a good deal; cheap for Thai food. The employees are really nice. They gave us complimentary green tea ice cream on my first visit. When I ordered takeout for lunch the second time, they brought me water and soup while I waited. I'm actually going back for lunch right now.  LOL!!  Oh. I didn't give five stars because it's not the best Thai food I've had. But the price, service and quality is good enough to keep going back.

yilCYTSjeRCgywWYnJUb2w.text: Very good! Best Satay, red curry, mango sticky rice, and coconut ice cream :)

VEqaDJpFBtm6JryeuGZz0w.text: Very delicious thai food! I got the Crab fried rice. Sweet and salty and perfect to my liking!

WCtQUSUPjxu7aGFvpJkivw.text: I tried Chanpen after reading the positive reviews here and wow, great hidden gem!  I did a takeout order of Yellow Chicken Curry, which wasn't on their menu, but they were accommodating, Salad rolls and chown mein thai style noodles.  They need to put it on the menu because the chicken was tender, the sauce was creamy, fragrant, sweet and spicy to our liking.  It was a generous portion for the price. The salad rolls with shrimp were hefty with lettuce, bean sprouts and shrimp wrapped in rice paper.  A meal in itself, but that didn't stop me from trying the other entrees and finishing everyone else's remaining morsels!  Now because the noodles were in a styrofoam to go container, it wasn't airtight so the sauce spilled out into the plastic carrying bag as it was driving home.  That was a downer, but the yakisoba noodles were covered with carrots, onions, crunchy cabbage, lots of tender chicken slices.  My kids would have liked more noodles but it was enough for 3 kids. No leftovers after this takeout adventure! So this was a successful Friday find! Yeah. I think the restaurant is quaint and beautifully decorated with booths and tables.  The service was fine.  Sorry no pics since we were super hungry and it smelled so diviine I forgot to take pics.

_qEOYxg1KJo8xFgH99joHQ.text: What a great find! Yelp brought me here, looks like this is their second location, and their original one was so well reviewed that we had to check it out. One thing that stood out to me was that the server asked if we wanted our dishes spicy on a scale from 1-5. I chose zero, but appreciated that he asked. The pad see ew was delicious. I especially enjoyed the complimentary coconut ice cream, which added a nice touch.

I ordered one seafood coconut soup and beef panang, despite the fancy look, the soup was ok, and i found a piece of pork inside it and i dont eat pork at all. The beef panang was below average, i feel more tomatoes soup than the panang curry and i ordered it level 4, so it was supposed to be super spicy , the actual spicy level i tasted was 2. The Panang curry was great (although I didn't taste any cinnamon). Pad Thai was outstanding and definitely not dry, which is way to common. Basically, it was awesome! Go there. Definitely.

BNoAuybdAw61SQE6H1ez_A.text: This is my absolute favorite Thai restaurant in town! The most authentic Thai food I've been able to find in the greater Phoenix area. My favorite dishes are the chicken pad Thai and the pineapple red curry! They are quick and delicious! If you dine in they give you complimentary green tea ice cream, which is a nice little dessert for the sweet tooth. If you order take out try give free bottles of water. Definitely recommend to anyone!

rNb68ocZDRFosa6ZaFekEg.text: Ordered the fried rice with brown rice, very tasty. (very generous)  I took the leftovers home. They don't pack it for you, they give you a styrofoam box for you to fill up. They do give you complementary ice cream at the end of your meal which was awesome. That was a nice touch. Service was on point, we had two waitresses. We got the check very quick without asking us if we wanted another drink. Felt rushed. Inside was very clean and nicely decorated. I would go back if I was shopping at Fry's and felt hungry.

gqaqXZjrvgVmv1jEW2oRlQ.text: The food was OK but definitley not 5 starts like the current yelp rating is. If you are looking for authentic thai food in OK quality, this is the place.

MxsE24z8g6-GlrtsreSbog.text: Ths is a fine place for Thai food. They were suggested by our Timeshare, shame on me for not checking with Yelp. They are in a strip mall at 48 St. and Baseline.    Our server was a very pleasant fellow named Mod. His knowledge and helpfulness was impressive.    The pineapple fried rice was a clear winner. It was hot and tasty with 3.5-star heat, and big shrimp and plenty of big fresh pineapple chinks, plus lots of tasty chicken.     I was ready to add soy sauce but nothing was really needed. The stir fried snow peas with beef was a mild and tasty treat.There were lots of onions, thin slices of beef, and carrots.    They served up tea flavored ice cream gratis and it was delicious. They were out of coconut ice cream a house favorite. I want to sample their Panang curry on our next visit.

oybWr-DL8X6PsZEVSfkICA.text: One of my favorites in the Valley (I miss Thai Hut). This shop is great, very friendly staff, great food.

qMLTX3R8vr2cNww_y-uOgQ.text: This Chanpen location serves the same quality food as the hole in the wall "original" but in a much nicer, more upscale setting, plus they have a liquor license.    3 of us (plus one baby) had dinner there last week and all went home happy.  Even the baby was happy ;)    We started with an order of crab wonton which was delicious.    And then I "chickened out" and ordered the sweet & sour chicken.   I was really pleased with it.   Far too many times, I have ordered this dish from other restaurants only to find that the sauce drowning the chicken is store bought and entirely too sweet.    Clearly, Chanpen's sweet and sour sauce is housemade and that makes all the difference in how this dish tastes, on top of the fact that the chicken itself was perfectly cooked.   Both of the ladies in our group were more adventurous and ordered curry dishes (one in a level 2 heat and the other in a level 3) and coconut soup, and both reported they were very pleased.  I tried all of the above and it was all quite tasty.   After dinner, they brought us all a small portion of green tea ice cream.  Let me tell you, the baby loved that.  After being a little fussy during dinner, that kid piped down and loved every bit of that ice cream!     Service was great - attentive and friendly.   Great dinner spot!

FHzqIH3zFdX2F_LtX5oqSw.text: This place is SO good. We have ordered the spicy noodles, chow mein, ginger chicken, crispy egg rolls, Thai iced tea and yellow curry and all have been excellent. The first time we went, we ordered with a spice level of 3 and it was spicy but manageable. The second time, we ordered three again and it was significantly spicier (but still delicious between gulps of water). I would recommend ordering one level lower than you normally would. They give you complimentary coconut ice cream at the end of your meal when you dine in. Service is great, prices are reasonable, and the food is incredible.

fi259MB1154v6OX385xdDA.text: Oh gosh, I would love to give this place 4 stars because I love to support small local business, but this place wasn't quuuuite there yet for me.  It could also be that I didn't order the right things and possibly their other entrees are tastier.  We ordered the pineapple fried rice with chicken and the silver noodles stir fried with vegetables and shrimp.  What I love about Thai food is how flavorful the food is and that the flavors always have lots of depth, with lots of different spices, etc.  The flavors here fell a little flat for me.  The pineapple fried rice could have used more herbs and maybe basil or something, because it just had that yellow curry taste to me.  Same for the silver noodles, the flavor wasn't wonderful.  I will say they did give me a lot of shrimp, and the shrimp were really BIG!  The Thai tea also wasn't my favorite. There was too much cream and not enough tea.  I did appreciate the complimentary coconut icecream for dessert, that was a nice tough, although I am lactose intolerant so I only took a small nibble to be polite.  It tasted good though!  Even my boyfriend who doesn't like coconut ate his whole iceream portion.  The restaurant itself is so nice looking inside.  I love that they separated it out into two sections.  One section has these modern booths and the other side has regular tables. It'd be a nice place to host a large group (bc when we came on Saturday night there was only 1 other table).  I may come back here and try a different dish, but so far my other favorite Thai restaurants are preferred.

g3bLKH21QwXSuQS87jnK9w.text: This location is way easier to get a seat at then the Broadway location.  The service was pretty good.  Only thing keeping it from a 5 star is the uncomfortable seating.  Did not care for the hard/short booth at all.  The coconut soup is the bomb. The eggplant with tofu is delicious.  We got a heat level 2 and I think next time we will stick to a 1 because it was just a pinch to hot for our tastes.

erPf5UTYjbcvjOzrA17zfQ.text: Come. Eat. Repeat.  After a late flight into PHX we were craving some good Thai. With most of my favorite options closing before we could get there, I turned to Yelpers for guidance. You did well, young padawans!  I grew up in this area and have seen this space change hands over and over. I'm excited to see Chanpen take the corner of a dingy strip mall to new culinary levels!  The food was hot, fresh, and delicious. Spice levels 1-5 and our '4's of drunken noodles and curry dishes left us with a satisfying belly-warming sensation, just the way we like it! Portions were large enough that I had lunch for several days - bonus! There were several specials on the board that sounded fantastic (pumpkin curry!) but sadly not enough room to try them all. Which just means we'll have to come back!  Reasonable prices, comfortable seating, attentive service. One complaint - the menu is REALLY hard to read. Please calm down with the background graphics. It will make it much easier on the eyes.

YzQwMQd9JR3qPm9UpL72zA.text: One of our favorite Thai restaurants.  The curry is very authentic, along with the selection on the menu.  Even some non-Thai, American favorites for Asian food such as the crab puffs, Incase you aren't finding something you like.  We have been slowly working our way through the menu, and have never once been disappointed.  We very much enjoy the staff who are very friendly, and make it feel like a family run place.

y3x4w1Q_HYznh4pSzVoQ-Q.text: The food here was excellent! We shared the chicken, shrimp, and glass noodle soup. The soup was presented nicely, flame and all. The chicken was tender nicely sliced, shrimp was plump and clean. All the vegetables were fresh. The stock was so wonderfully seasoned. We also had the sweet and sour chicken. It was not the overly battered fried junk. It was lightly coated, sauted, and finished in a wonderful sauce accompanied by fresh cubed pineapple. They provided complimentary orange sherbert after the entrees - nicely done but we went for the coconut icecream served with a side of crushed peanuts and chocolate sauce to drizzle. Did I mention they start you with refreshing cucumber water?  What a find! We normally would drive right into Tempe or Chandler. This place will be a future destination for sure. Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Chanpen Thai Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. This is fantastic!

t-bfiBsdFEO0yq1twL90_w.text: My friends love this place they always order takeout from here so I decided to try it. Came on Thursday night so it wasn't all too busy. It was cold out so I ordered Wonton soup. It was pretty good. Portion sizes are great and at the end we got a complimentary green tea ice cream which was delicious! My only issue was the service at the end when they took quite sometime to bring the check.

photos.caption: Photo of Chanpen Thai Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States

JeNXjkz0gw4D0vLSumZbTA.text: This is some of the best Thai food I've found so far in the Phoenix area.  Their spice scale is a little more aggressive than most places (maybe they're more authentic?), so make sure to take that into account when ordering.  I'm a 2/5 fan here, and I do okay with spicy food.  My husband loves it when his eyes are watering, he's choking and his tongue is burning, and the 3/5 was good for him.  We had the green avocado curry (absolutely delicious - it was on the special menu that day) and a pineapple red curry.  I honestly don't think there's a curry dish you could get here that would be disappointing.  The free coconut ice cream at the end of the meal is the perfect touch.  I'll be back every time I'm in the area (and likely sometimes when I'm not).

XR78ZYrTBORitCHbBsbzxQ.text: The servers were friendly. They ask you to rate your level of spiciness (1-5?) when ordering which I liked since I like Thai food to be a little flavorful. It is located in a strip mall next to boba/donut place. The pad see ew was delicious. The pad thai had an orange hue that I was not used to. Everything else was great. I look forward to coming back.

iLFlI4gvyNt303OkfduvgQ.text: Chanpen has been a long time favorite of mine. The food is consistently great and the service is mostly dependable. What I really want to highlight here is the lunch special. They know what they're doing with their lunch service. They understand how people that work in nearby offices want to get in and out on their lunch breaks and they do it better than anywhere else! They are so fast and efficient at lunch time. I will always recommend this place for excellent food and service, but there is simply no beating their lunchtime hustle to get you fed in a reasonable amount of time. Definitely consider this for your next lunch meeting!

1K9GGjvLtygQ01n9-KLGzg.text: Not our style of Thai. Panang currey was savory. Peanut sauce was also missing the sweet we are accustomed to.

zydtiug7BmrosjLbmuv2Zw.text: Next to Frys - Good Food At Fair Prices...  They start you off with a smile and a little cup of veggie soup.   I ordered the pad see ew with chicken at Thai spicy for the level of greatness! The food was probably 3.75 of 5 stars... No the freshest tasting but not bad...  The staff was very quiet but friendly. When I was leaving my waitress talked a bit to me about Thailand since I was speaking some Thai to her...  Thai soap operas are a funny Asian thing... I am not a TV while eating kind of guy, but Thai and Laotian people really live to have those soap operas going.... Lol....

photos.caption: Photo of Chanpen Thai Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Pad see ew chicken
Photo of Chanpen Thai Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Lunch specials for Monday to Friday only

DXFEKd6FliYyeegjtWlnKA.text: So good! Excellent service, great food quality and presentation, good atmosphere. We especially enjoyed the pineapple red curry. Fair warning though- the spice level here was more intense than we have experienced at other Thai restaurants. I usually order a 3, but found my pad Thai to be much spicier than I'm used to. It was still delicious, but made my eyes water! Also, complimentary green tea ice cream at the end of the meal is a lovely touch! Would definitely go again!

FYibOqXt4afqXKM12o1GDw.text: Great little hidden gem. Just tried this place about a week ago and have been back twice.  Great fresh food prepared to perfection,  nice staff and nice ambiance.  My new go-to spot.

cOOIk-goEEq9OSgAyyc_CA.text: Stopped in for dinner with my family. The place is quiet and dark but has a nice atmosphere. The staff are quick and friendly. The water comes in large Mason jars which was quite interesting. The food came out quickly and they were delicious. We had seafood hotpot which was hot and flavorful. We also had an order of drunken noodle with roast duck. It was a little too salty but when paired with rice, it tasted more balanced. I had a great experience here.

THoXMsMuw3Mh9XEGXqA71g.text: Second time coming here. The restaurant is new so the inside is pretty modern and bigger than the original one. Service was nice, but it kinda felt rushed. Once we got the food they handed us the check immediately and didn't really bother to come check up or refill drinks.   Other than the the food was decent. I always order the lemongrass soup with seafood with a level 3 spice. The flavorful is great if you like lemongrass. It is served on a hot pot type thing which keeps your soup hot!:) It is enough to feed at least 3 people. The seafood portion for the soup is plenty. It comes with mussels, squid, fish and a couple of shrimp. I suggest getting this is you're a soup person.   The other dish I got was the orange chicken. It's not normally on the menu but it was presented on the specials board. It was served on top of greens and sliced oranges. Portion size was pretty decent. The chicken was nice and crispy. Great flavoring not too sweet and not too crazy with the orange flavoring. Only downside is that it was caked in batter.

photos.caption: Photo of Chanpen Thai Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Lemongrass soup with seafood
Photo of Chanpen Thai Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Lemongrass soup with seafood

JYUTCmVquBSKQf4Mea9DMg.text: Food is delicious although spice level can be off from what you ask. I get spice level 2 every single time but sometimes 2 is more than I can handle & other times it tastes just fine. Staff is very friendly also.

pvCSwgMD0WqN7GEnYGKwFQ.text: I rarely write reviews unless the place is a extreme ripoff or extremely good. This place is extremely good. I hadn't had Thai food in awhile and took my daughter there. We both left saying how great the place was, the friendly service, the portion size and presentation, then we were surprised with coconut ice cream at the end. This is one of the places in this city doing it right.

XOF9fPxvilsOrFEColL6vg.text: This is a hole in the wall worth visiting.  Nice laid back atmosphere.  Service was fast and friendly.   They give you mason jars of water and coconut ice cream to finish.  l like spicy food and often times when you say medium it's pretty mild and you have to specifically ask for Thai spicy just to get some heat.  I ordered medium and it was spicy enough to make me glad I didn't make the "Thai spicy" assumption here.  Had a couple of curry dishes and they were quite flavorful.     I noticed their blackboard after ordering, which was a bit of a bummer, as they had avocado curry.  Never had that before but it gives me a reason to come back.

1oGMGA36EeGc4W0qUic85w.text: This is the most disappointing Thai food I have ever had.  It's a shame, because the location is convenient and ambience in ok.

howwKBu9wAFxpG6nuugoUw.text: Came for lunch on a Sat. Afternoon. Only 1 other table in the restaurant.  I ordered the shrimp and chicken pad Thai, the flavor was good but only had 2 shrimp in it and the chicken was very dry. My husband ordered the pork and snow pea stir fry. The pork was not stir fried and absolutely no stir fry sauce,  totally dry. Thai Basil is by far a better choice!!

8jNt_rpB83N8Smst949mrw.text: Im here now and just left. The lady at the cashiers said, "We close in 15 min. If you want food youll have to take it to go. She didnt say hi, those were the first words that came out of her mouth and was not polite and made it seems like we were a bother. I told her no thats ok because you made it seem like we were bothering you.  She didnt disagree, but said ok. I get that you're about to close in 15 minutes but I didn't know that. I wish she didnt have to be rude about it so that I didn't have to write this shitty review. I see that this restaurant has 4 stars so they pretty much dont care for new customers. My friends, family and  co workers will know about this. This restaurant wont probably care.

3FGyoYeYHy5KJqFtfIAtCw.text: The worst place you can get your food from. We waited for 45 mins for a pick up order, before we were asked to leave without food by the waiter. He literally asked me to leave without food because I asked him to give my food in next 5 mins. Didn't even apologize for the delay.   I am pregnant and there was no place to even sit and wait for that long, and the waiter says I have to wait for somemore time coz there are ppl waiting from 1 hour and they need to get their food first. And he went on ahead and said they cannot give me a time for when the food would be ready, coz they don't know exactly how long it would take.   Very rude behaviour from the waiter, even if the food is good the waiters can spoil your appetite with their behaviour.

RBlRopDLZNPZI2TfT8b2qg.text: The red curry was soooo amazing!!! I stopped here because I'm driving through AZ and I have to say this place is legit! I was asked for how hot I wanted this on a 1-5 scale... Being Mexican, I got a 4 and it was just dreamy. I highly recommend this place and if I ever come back to this city I will definitely have to stop here again!

GCA83St3O1c_l0x9oRz4dA.text: Tempe is a hike for us. Chanpan was worth the drive due to the following:  Atmosphere - casual dining, quiet nice space.  Staff - kind and knowledgeable about their products yet busy even at 9pm on a Saturday night.  Food - amazingly good, spice was just right, portions very generous, flavors outstanding. We ordered our usual Pad Thai, Silver Noodle Soup, and Chicken Satay. Each of our selections stood the test of our extensive Thai Food experiences with the exception of never having been to Thailand, definitely on the bucket list though!

7vOQ3Kv_qGDpCoQ-VpzGOw.text: I had to try this place twice.. my second time was their curry and that hit the spot (: now my husband and I are recurring customers!

yxAzpBEbM-TcBgMgC79LQA.text: I found this to be the best Thai place since I've moved back here from Bay Area.  We orderedCrab puffs , The fresh rolls ,House fried rice, Red curry  and Sticky mango rice. Every single thing was delicious and now will be a regular since we found a great Thai spot in PHX.

i8ex1GJIDqGIKoU8F2rsFA.text: Everything was great! This was our second visit in three days. Food was prepared well and served hot. The coconut ice cream for dessert was a great finish for a fantastic meal. We had shrimp wrapped vegetable rolls and pad ti.

Ap9QXEWIWPZuuAdxGawCCw.text: I hope the food is good because the service stinks.  Walked in at 8:30 and was told, "We close at 9:00 but we wanted to let you in.  Are you going to order to go?" Seated myself at one table - tabletop was dirty... Moved to the next...less dirty but not clean.  Was handed a mason jar full of ice water and floating chunks of what I will optimistically assume to be tea leaves.  Staff is eating in the kitchen (visible through counter pass through) A lady with two small kids (4-5) just walked into the kitchen.  The food is nothing special; main course only no side soup or salad.  The drunken noodles are gritty.  Overall, avoid this place.

40EXMa5M8D06KIWg9TB3rw.text: The place was easy to location.  It was clean and nice.  The staff was super friendly.  The food was just ok.  The Thai ice tea kick butts, so good.    The satay chicken was not grilled it more fried in the deep fryer.  The peanut sauce did not have the super savor flavor.  The wonton soup was too salty for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Chanpen Thai Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Thai ice tea with cream

a3IW1z4rI3bJ8Gtms8-8BQ.text: This has become my favorite Thai restaurant and I crave it all the time! The service is amazing, the staff is always genuinely friendly and attentive, and the food always comes out reasonably fast! I love their pad-see-ew (savory wide noodles) and their yellow curry is awesome too! I also love their spicy fried rice and mango with sweet rice dessert. Those are usually my go-to dishes and I've never been disappointed. I hate when I try a place I like but they don't have consistently good food, where my next visit yields a completely different taste. Not the case here, they always deliver delicious food every time. That's why I'll skip the Thai restaurants close to me and drive the 15 minutes to eat here instead.

xzk2uP_HyGISDdpd9mt-Iw.text: Best Thai food. Fresh food. I have been here for so many times. Everything so wonderful. I had Tom Yum soup with Seafood, Pad Thai, Basil Fish, and Curry duck. OMG food was amazing and tasty. Service was friendly. They give me complimentary ice cream!! Love Chanpen Thai   Authentic and Delicious Thai food. Great Service. Big and beautiful restaurant.

SLsocDxmyohYexlsKXQCzg.text: Great customer service and delicious food! Seriously the best Thai in AZ! Both locations are great, for a hole in the wall experience, go to the one on broadway for a more upscale experience come to baseline.

QDGT8Cqwu9HfRuev7pIx3w.text: Awesome!! Best Asian Fast Food in the neighborhood! Pad Thai is the best in Arizona. Most places don't come close!

C88Sxa7RfgZY1hG7jaHl_A.text: Great drunken noodles with beef.  Dinner came with coconut ice cream which was yummy too!

o6nx5nGEcqTNVbhwzqsgGA.text: I'm so happy they have a 2nd location. The food is amazing and I love the ambiance of the new place. Plus, this location is open later!
